intro: Vicia talpa, commonly known as the field vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in disturbed soils and open fields. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep purple. Its pods contain several elliptical seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by wind and animals. Vicia talpa is notable for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it an important plant in ecological and agricultural contexts.
